Crime_Name: Trademark Infringement and Breach of Contract
Dispute_Type: Termination of franchise agreement, continued use of trademarks
Legal_Issue: Whether plaintiffs can obtain an interlocutory injunction for trademark infringement and false representation
Evidence_Assessment: Both parties presented credible arguments; serious issues to be tried
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant must show serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Credibility_Factor: Mutual credibility of claims regarding termination and payment obligations
Legal_Rule: Interlocutory injunction requires: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Procedural_Issue: Timing and conditions of injunction during ongoing litigation
Grounds_for_Claim: Trademark infringement post-termination, breach of contract
Review_Standard: Balance of convenience, status quo maintenance
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Both sides heard; court imposed neutral condition to preserve rights
Key_Evidence_Considered: Franchise agreement terms, payment history, use of trademarks after termination
Legal_Framework: Canadian trademark law, contractual obligations, clean hands doctrine
Applicant_Challenge: Failure to demonstrate irreparable harm or clear balance of convenience
Court_Result: Status quo maintained via trust payments pending final resolution
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles on interlocutory injunctions, Trademarks Act
Standard_of_Proof: Serious issue to be tried (interim standard)
Defendant_Response: Claimed breach of contract and sought specific performance
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (contract), financial records, legal arguments
Remedy_Requested: Interlocutory injunction to stop trademark use
Outcome: Injunction denied; conditional status quo imposed
Remedy_Sought: Cease use of trademarks pending trial
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination with interim equitable conditions
Legal_Provision: Franchise agreement clauses, Trademarks Act provisions
Authority: Court with jurisdiction over intellectual property and contract disputes
Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant sections of the Trademarks Act, contract law principles
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Disputed termination of contract, unauthorized trademark use
Jurisdiction: Provincial court with civil and IP jurisdiction
Governing_Rule: Interlocutory injunction criteria under Canadian law
